title: Quiz 3: Applied Health Services & Planning
description: Covers practical applications including immunization schedules, family planning, nutrition, environmental health, and program planning (Log-frames).

questions.question: Match the vaccine with its correct route of administration:
questions.explanation: BCG is ID, OPV is Oral, Pentavalent is IM, and Measles is Subcutaneous.
questions.hint: Polio goes in the mouth; BCG leaves a scar on the arm.

questions.question: Arrange the Tetanus Toxoid (TT) immunization schedule for pregnant women:

items.text: 4th dose: At least 1 year after 3rd dose
5th dose: At least 1 year after 4th dose

questions.explanation: TT Schedule: Contact -> 4 weeks -> 6 months -> 1 year -> 1 year.
questions.hint: The intervals get longer: weeks, then months, then years.

questions.question: At what age is the Measles vaccine given in the Kenya Expanded Programme on Immunization (KEPI) schedule?
questions.explanation: Measles vaccine is administered at 9 months of age.
questions.hint: It is usually the last vaccine in the infant schedule.

questions.question: Which of the following are categorized as 'Barrier Methods' of family planning?
questions.explanation: Barrier methods physically block sperm. Pills and injectables are hormonal methods.
questions.hint: Select methods that create a physical wall or barrier.

questions.question: Match the type of malnutrition with its description:

pairs.right: Severe wasting of fat/tissue due to lack of calories
Bilateral pitting oedema (fluid retention) due to protein deficiency
Low height-for-age due to chronic malnutrition
Deficiency in vitamins/minerals (e.g., Iron, Vitamin A)

questions.hint: Kwashiorkor makes the child look plump (edema); Marasmus makes them look old/wasted.

questions.question: In the M&E Log Frame below, what is the 'Means of Verification' for the activity 'Distribute Chlorine'?

richContent.content:
ActivityIndicatorMeans of Verification
Distribute Chlorine# of homes suppliedHousehold Survey / Distribution List
Drill Boreholes# of boreholes drilledSurvey

questions.explanation: The table explicitly lists 'Household Survey / Distribution List' as the means of verification.
questions.hint: Look at the third column in the first row.

questions.question: A SMART goal must be Specific, Measurable, Attainable, ___BLANK___, and Time-related.
questions.explanation: SMART stands for Specific, Measurable, Attainable, Relevant, and Time-related.
questions.hint: It starts with 'R' - the goal must match your needs.

questions.question: Environmental health only concerns protecting wildlife and forests, not human disease.
questions.explanation: Environmental health is specifically about preventing or controlling disease, injury, and disability related to the interactions between *people* and their environment.
questions.hint: Think about water quality, air pollution, and sanitation affecting humans.

questions.question: Arrange the Planning Cycle steps in the correct order:
questions.explanation: Planning moves from analyzing the situation -> setting objectives -> choosing strategies -> planning operations -> implementing/evaluating.
questions.hint: You must analyze the situation before you can set objectives.

questions.question: What are the essential 'Key Success Measures' for an organization?
questions.explanation: The 4 essential measures are financial viability, customer satisfaction, employee satisfaction, and contribution to society.
questions.hint: Think about money, clients, staff, and community.
